alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross; Lee; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 11:58AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lee, St. Francis, southwestern Crittenden and southeastern Cross Counties through 1230 PM CST... At 1157 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Palestine, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Forrest City, Marion, Hughes, Madison, Palestine, Village Creek State Park, Caldwell, Crawfordsville, Edmondson, Colt, Widener, Anthonyville, Haynes, Jennette, Garret Grove, Simsboro, Pinckney, New Salem and New Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee.
